availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Henry E Collins (Merchant, 2nd Regiment Ky Cav)

body.p: Born near New Castle, Ireland in 1832. Emigrated to Cincinnati hen he was five years old. Educated at Woodward College. Moved to St. Paul, Minnesota 1847 to pursue business. Went into business at a retail boot and shoe store in Cincinnati in 1852. Sold the store in 1856. Married Mary F. Coffin by which he had two sons and one daughter. Served in the Second Kentucky Cavalry. He Died on July 11, 1881.

bibl.p: Society of the Army of the Cumberland, *Reunion of the Society of the Army of the Cumberland, Volume 14 (Cincinnati: Robert Clarke & Co., 1888), 224.
